text: today I'm making one of my all-time
favorite recipes macaroni and cheese but
guess what I'm making it gluten free so
all your gluten free friends will be
able to enjoy your mac and cheese right
along with you to start off mince and
onion I like to really really finely
mince my onion when I'm making cheese
sauces so that they're not big chunks in
there I like onion to sort of dissolve
into the bechamel a little bit my onion
is ready for my sauce I'm going to get
my topping ready and then I'll move on
to making the sauce here at my puffed
rice cereal it's 1/2 a cup to that add
one ounce of grated Parmesan cheese 2
tablespoons of melted unsalted butter
it'll become a nice golden crunchy
topping melt 2 tablespoons of unsalted
butter in a saucepan and add your onion
1 just cook your onion until it's
translucent shouldn't take more than a
couple minutes add 2 tablespoons of
cornstarch so this is gluten free
substitute for flour which is usually
used thicken a bechamel stir your onions
and cornstarch so the cornstarch gets
coated with the fat combines with your
onions before you whisk in your milk 2
cups milk make sure it does fully boil
because not all the cornstarch will
activate before it is boiling so very
very important that looks really good
it's not SuperDuper thick of a sauce but
it's nice it'll be perfect for coating
your pasta remove it from the heat to
have a cheese I have 12 ounces of
shredded cheddar cheese I like extra
sharp but choose your preferred
sharpness and for a little more zing a
teaspoon of Dijon mustard you like you
could use rainy mustard that would be
pretty cool too some salt and pepper
I'm not gonna add too much before I
started cheese because I don't know how
salty that cheese is gonna make the
sauce whisk until the cheese melts the
orange cheese definitely gives it that
box macaroni and cheese look so if you
like that or if you find that appealing
you can use yellow but white is just as
good now you want to combine your pasta
and your sauce this is 12 ounces of
gluten-free penne sir to combine and
have your oven preheating to 350 degrees
this is gonna
bake again afterwards pour it into your
pans
I'm a family-style kind of girl so I'm
gonna do it in the two quart baking dish
then sprinkle your topping on and this
just gets baked until everything is
bubbling the topping is golden brown
takes about 15 or 20 minutes at 350
degrees
voila spoon sum up a little bit creamy a
little bit crunchy 100 percent gluten
free
mac and cheese enjoy
you
